edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.BaseActor
      • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.WorldActor
        • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Enemy

  • public class Enemy
extends WorldActor
    Enemies are things to be avoided or defeated by the Hero. Enemies do damage to heroes when they collide with heroes, and enemies can be defeated by heroes, in a variety of ways.

    • Method Detail

      • setDamage

        public void setDamage(int amount)
        Set the amount of damage that this enemy does to a hero
        Parameters:
        amount - Amount of damage. The default is 2, since heroes have a default strength of 1, so that the enemy defeats the hero but does not disappear.

      • setDefeatHeroText

        public void setDefeatHeroText(java.lang.String message)
        If this enemy defeats the last hero of the board, this is the message that will be displayed
        Parameters:
        message - The message to display

      • defeat

        public void defeat(boolean increaseScore)
        When an enemy is defeated, this this code figures out how gameplay should change.
        Parameters:
        increaseScore - Indicate if we should increase the score when this enemy is defeated

      • setDefeatByCrawl

        public void setDefeatByCrawl()
        Indicate that this enemy can be defeated by crawling into it

      • setDefeatByJump

        public void setDefeatByJump()
        Mark this enemy as one that can be defeated by jumping

      • setResistInvincibility

        public void setResistInvincibility()
        Make this enemy resist invincibility

      • setImmuneToInvincibility

        public void setImmuneToInvincibility()
        Make this enemy damage the hero even when the hero is invincible

      • setDisappearOnTouch

        public void setDisappearOnTouch()
        Indicate that if the player touches this enemy, the enemy will be removed from the game

      • setDefeatCallback

        public void setDefeatCallback(LolActorEvent callback)
        Provide code to run when this Enemy is defeated
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to run when the enemy is defeated. Note that a value of null will remove a previously-set callback

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean val)
        Specify whether this Renderable object is enabled or disabled. When it is disabled, it effectively does not exist in the game.
        Parameters:
        val - The new state (true for enabled, false for disabled)

      • getEnabled

        public boolean getEnabled()
        Return the current enabled/disabled state of this Renderable
        Returns:
        The state of the renderable
